org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.impl.mtPlant

Class ReactorPoolThreadManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.impl.mtPlant.ReactorPoolThreadManager

  • public final class ReactorPoolThreadManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The ReactorPoolThreadManager is used to process a queue of Reactor's that have non-empty inboxes. ReactorPoolThreadManager is a thread pool, but it has a simplified API and assumes that the thread pool has a fixed number of threads. ReactorPoolThreadManager is also responsible for assigning the threadReference when a Reactor is run.

      • ReactorPoolThreadManager

        public ReactorPoolThreadManager(int _threadCount,
                        int _maxThreadMigrations,
                        java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory _threadFactory)
        Create a ReactorPoolThreadManager
        Parameters:
        _threadCount - The number of threads to be created.
        _threadFactory - Used to create the threads.
        _maxThreadMigrations - Limits the number of times a thread will follow a message in succession.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public final void execute(PoolThreadReactorMtImpl _reactor)
        Begin running a targetReactor.
        Parameters:
        _reactor - The run method is to be called by the selected thread.

      • close

        public final void close()
        The close method is used to stop all the threads as they become idle. This method sets a flag to indicate that the thread should stop and then wakes up all the threads.
